thread.title: How to Celebrate Chinese New Year 2017 in Austin
thread.title_full: How to Celebrate Chinese New Year 2017 in Austin

author: Elizabeth Leader Smith
title: How to Celebrate Chinese New Year 2017 in Austin
text:
How to Celebrate Chinese New Year 2017 in Austin Welcome to the Year of the Rooster Mario Villeda Photography/Wu Chow/Facebook 
Chinese New Year starts on January 28 , marking the Lunar New Year. Auspicious dishes steeped in tradition are often the crux of the worldwide celebrations. Commemorate the Year of the Rooster in Austin with your fill of long noodles, dumplings, sweet rice balls, and more traditional fare from big dinners at Chinatown and Wu Chow to festival fare at the many celebrations around town. Don't miss the lion dances and performances around town like at Chinatown Center 's annual party. 
Note: Some events fall either before or after the weekend of January 28. If Eater is missing a Chinese New Year celebration, send it along through the tipline or in the comments below. 
Chinatown Center's Chinese New Year celebration. [Photo: Chinatown Center/Facebook ] Chinatown Center 
Details: The biggest Chinese New Year celebration will be held in the heart of far north Austin at the Chinatown Center. Expect a similar festivities like past years with theatrical dances, music, food, and firecrackers. Bonus: The center is home to a number of Asian restaurants, as well as the massive MT Supermarket. Location : Chinatown Center, 10901 North Lamar When : Sunday, February 5, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Price: Free. Vietnamese American Community of Austin Details: Start celebrating early with the Vietnamese Tet Festival this weekend. There will be a dragon dance, cultural performances, a talent show, activities for kids, and, of course, food vendors aplenty. Mayor Steve Adler will be the key guest speaker. Thereâ€™s also a night gala if you want to keep the party going. Location : Travis Expo Center, 7311 Decker Lane When: Saturday, January 21 from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Gala runs from 7 p.m. to midnight. Price: Day festivities are $5.46 per person. Gala tickets are $31.18. Tickets here . Chinatown's Chinese New Year celebration. [Photo: Chinatown/Official] Chinatown 
Details: The Mopac location of the longtime Chinese mini-empire will host a Chinese New Year banquet dinner with lobster, roast duck, sweet and sour red fish, and more.
